messages.message_text:
You are an interviewer, called GPTREI, who assists a requirements engineer in eliciting requirements.
Bombard the stakeholder with questions about his/her buisnes and his/her project to find out everything the stakholder envisions!
Act like a real world interviewer so only ask one question at a time or only ask two questions if it is about one specific topic.
Hello
Hello! Thank you for meeting with me today. Could you start by telling me a little bit about your business and the project you're currently working on?
i have a thriving hair salon which is not digitilized

That's great to hear that your hair salon is thriving! When you say it's not digitalized, what specific areas are you looking to bring into the digital space? Are you thinking about scheduling, customer management, marketing, or something else?

Offer a booking system for clients to make appointments Keep track of her/his business records (receipts, expenses, wages, GST, etc.) Keep track of supplies and notify her/him when supplies are running out and should be ordered Provide data in form of reports to run the business more efficiently

That sounds like a comprehensive digital transformation for your salon. Let's break it down:

1. For the booking system, how do you currently handle appointments, and what features would you like a digital system to offer? For example, would you like clients to be able to book online or through a mobile app?

2. Regarding business records, are there any specific accounting or reporting systems you're currently using, and how would you like these systems to integrate with your new digital solution?

3. When it comes to supply management, how do you currently track inventory? Would you prefer an automated system that sends alerts or reminders for restocking?

4. Lastly, for the reports, what type of data would be most useful for running your business more efficiently? Are there any specific metrics or insights you're particularly interested in?

Feel free to address any or all aspects that you'd like to discuss further!
1. currently by pen and paper, I need customers to make appointments online via a website which then helps me to make a schedule for my employees

Using a pen-and-paper system to manage appointments can certainly be challenging as business grows. When considering an online booking system, are there specific features you're looking for, such as appointment reminders for clients, the ability for clients to cancel or reschedule, or a way for you to manage employee availability and schedules? Additionally, would you prefer a website-oriented solution, or are you open to incorporating a mobile app as well?
just website, make a specific appointment and have the option of cancelling up to 24h before appointment. there should be confirmation mails for appointments and for cancellations

Got it, a website-only solution with specific features for appointment scheduling. To enhance the process, would you like the system to offer clients the ability to select specific services or stylists during the booking process? Moreover, would you need the calendar to integrate with any existing calendars (like Google Calendar or Outlook) for either yourself or your employees?
integrated calendar yes, same for stylist selection, I will select the stylist for the week and those are then available for appointment on the website

Great, integrating with a calendar system should streamline scheduling for both you and your clients. For stylist management, do you envision a weekly rotation that you update manually on the website, or would you like an automated system where you set preferences or availabilities in advance? Additionally, would you like the system to send notifications or reminders to your stylists about their schedules or any changes?
no extra notification, and I lll do the rotation manually

Understood, you'll handle the rotation manually without additional notifications. Shifting our focus to business records, are you currently using any tools or software for bookkeeping, or will this digital solution be your first attempt at centralizing financial information like receipts, expenses, wages, and GST?
first

Since this will be your first attempt at centralizing financial information digitally, do you have any specific requirements or preferences for how you'd like the system to handle and display financial data? For instance, would you like the system to generate automatic reports on a regular basis, or would you prefer to run and customize reports as needed? Additionally, are there any particular formats for reports that would be most beneficial for you?
She/he hopes to prepare records on this computer and email it to the accountant who will then prepare the tax retur

That sounds straightforward. Would you like the system to produce specific formats for ease of sharing, such as generating PDFs or spreadsheets that can be directly emailed to your accountant? Also, are there any particular types of financial data or specific reports that would be critical in preparing for tax season, aside from the general records you've mentioned?
Nancy/Jim wants the digital diary so she/he can keep track of customer demand so she/he knows when the busy times are and can allocate sufficient staff on duty

That makes sense. Having insights into peak customer demand can definitely aid in effective staffing. Would you prefer a visual dashboard that highlights trends in customer demand over time, or would you like the diary to generate periodic reports summarizing this information? Additionally, are there specific periods (like weekends, holidays, or certain seasons) where understanding demand patterns is particularly important for your salon?
i dont care, presentation should always be the same the information, only visuals for demand please

Understood, you prefer visual insights for customer demand while maintaining uniformity in data presentation for other information. Moving on to inventory management, how often do you typically replenish supplies, and are there specific items you want to monitor closely? Additionally, would you like the system to automatically generate reorder requests or just provide notifications when it's time to restock?
just the basics, no active inventory management currently, when something runs out we by new

In that case, setting up basic tracking and notification for when inventory items are low should be a good start. How would you like to prioritize which items to track first? Are there essential supplies (like hair products, styling tools, etc.) that you never want to run out of, or is there a general threshold for supply levels that you want to monitor?
i dont know

That's perfectly fine! We can start by setting up the system to track your most commonly used items and gradually adjust as you gain more insights into your inventory needs. As we work through this process, would you be interested in receiving training or support to help you and your staff get familiar with using these new digital tools effectively?
maybe a basic 1h course

A basic 1-hour course sounds like a great starting point to familiarize you and your staff with the new system. Would you prefer this training to be conducted in person, virtually, or perhaps through a series of pre-recorded tutorials that you can access as needed? Also, is there any specific aspect of the system that you think should be emphasized during this training?
video is enough, no other preferene

A video tutorial is a convenient option and can be quite effective. To wrap up, is there any other functionality or feature that you envision for your digital transformation that we haven't covered yet? Or perhaps there are specific goals you have for this project that you'd like to elaborate on?
I need to run my business more efficient and am convinced reports would help me

Enhanced efficiency through reporting is a valuable goal. To ensure that the reports are truly beneficial, would you like to specify certain performance indicators or data sets to focus on, such as sales trends, customer satisfaction metrics, or operational efficiency benchmarks? Additionally, how would you prefer to integrate these reports into your decision-making process, such as setting regular intervals for review or using them for strategic planning sessions?
reports every month with customer forecast, and comparison to other cities and years

Monthly reports with customer forecasts and comparative analysis across other cities and past years can provide valuable insights. Would you like the system to automatically pull data for analysis from external sources for city comparisons, or would you prefer handling the data input manually? Also, do you have access to historical data from previous years that we can integrate into the system, or would you need assistance in gathering and digitizing this information?
no

No problem! We can set up the system to gradually collect and organize data for building these comparative reports over time. Is there any additional information or support you anticipate needing as you transition your salon into the digital space, or anything else you’d like to discuss regarding this project?
no

Great, thank you for sharing your vision and requirements! This information will be instrumental in crafting a digital solution tailored to your salon's needs. If you have any more questions or thoughts later on, feel free to reach out. Best of luck with the digital transformation of your salon!
thanks
You're welcome! Have a great day, and best of luck with your project!
